card.name: Abzan Advantage
card.ability: Target player sacrifices an enchantment. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
card.flavor: "To survive, you must seize every opportunity."\n—Daghatar the Adamant

card.name: Abzan Beastmaster
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest toughness or tied for the greatest toughness.
card.flavor: His beasts move the great siege towers of the Abzan across the endless sands.

card.name: Abzan Kin-Guard
card.ability: Abzan Kin-Guard has lifelink as long as you control a white or black permanent.
card.flavor: "The Mardu rush headlong toward extinction. We ensure the longevity of our clan by protecting our territory, not rampaging through it."

card.name: Abzan Runemark
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.\nEnchanted creature has vigilance as long as you control a black or green permanent.

card.name: Abzan Skycaptain
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Abzan Skycaptain dies, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: "A tempest is coming. Turn your faces toward the wind!"

card.name: Ainok Guide
card.ability: When Ainok Guide enters the battlefield, choose one —\n• Put a +1/+1 counter on Ainok Guide.\n• Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
card.ability: First strike\nWhenever Alesha, Who Smiles at Death attacks, you may pay {WB}{WB}. If you do, return target creature card with power 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped and attacking.
card.flavor: "Greet death with sword in hand."

card.name: Alesha's Vanguard
card.ability: Dash {2}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
card.flavor: Boundaries drawn on maps or marked with stone have no meaning for the Mardu.

card.name: Ambush Krotiq
card.ability: Trample\nWhen Ambush Krotiq enters the battlefield, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The Abzan merchants soon discovered why this route was clear of dragons.

card.name: Ancestral Vengeance
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhen Ancestral Vengeance enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.\nEnchanted creature gets -1/-1.
card.flavor: The defenses of the Abzan extend well beyond the walls of their fortresses.

card.name: Arashin Cleric
card.ability: When Arashin Cleric enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: "We'll have time to put out the fires when those trapped within the ruins are safe."

card.name: Arashin War Beast
card.ability: Whenever Arashin War Beast deals combat damage to one or more blocking creatures, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Arcbond
card.ability: Choose target creature. Whenever that creature is dealt damage this turn, it deals that much damage to each other creature and each player.
card.flavor: "If you must die today, make your death worthy of legend."\n—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

card.name: Archers of Qarsi
card.ability: Defender\nReach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: "We think of the naga as creeping cutthroats, slitherers in the swamps. But they are equally at home in the trees."\n—Goton, Qal Sisma shaman

card.name: Archfiend of Depravity
card.ability: Flying\nAt the beginning of each opponent's end step, that player chooses up to two creatures he or she controls, then sacrifices the rest.
card.flavor: "Why would I kill you all? Who then would be left to worship me?"

card.name: Atarka, World Render
card.ability: Flying, trample\nWhenever a Dragon you control attacks, it gains double strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Her hunger knows no limit. Left unchecked, she would feast on all of Tarkir."\n—Yasova Dragonclaw

card.name: Aven Skirmisher
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: "We do not hide from the dragons that pretend to rule the skies. If we did, the dragons would become our rulers, and our way of life would be lost."

card.name: Aven Surveyor
card.ability:
Flying
When Aven Surveyor enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Aven Surveyor.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Bathe in Dragonfire
card.ability: Bathe in Dragonfire deals 4 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: The scent of cooked flesh lingers in the charred landscape of Tarkir.

card.name: Battle Brawler
card.ability: As long as you control a red or white permanent, Battle Brawler gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
card.flavor: Every time he returns from battle unscathed, he feels a tinge of disappointment.

card.name: Battlefront Krushok
card.ability: Battlefront Krushok can't be blocked by more than one creature.\nEach creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: Krushoks clear debris from fertile fields, fallow fields, and battlefields.

card.name: Bloodfell Caves
card.ability: Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Bloodfire Enforcers
card.ability: Bloodfire Enforcers has first strike and trample as long as an instant card and a sorcery card are in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Bloodfire practitioners train to focus their rage, building it deep inside themselves until they are ready to release it as a devastating attack.

card.name: Blossoming Sands
card.ability: Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Break Through the Line
card.ability: {R}: Target creature with power 2 or less gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.
card.flavor: "If the Mardu were more in tune with their beasts, they would not scare so easily."\n—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

card.name: Brutal Hordechief
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control attacks, defending player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.\n{3}{RW}{RW}: Creatures your opponents control block this turn if able, and you choose how those creatures block.

card.name: Cached Defenses
card.ability: Bolster 3. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put three +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: The glittering scales in the Abzan vaults represent mighty deeds of the past and protection for generations to come.

card.name: Channel Harm
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn by sources you don't control. If damage is prevented this way, you may have Channel Harm deal that much damage to target creature.

card.name: Citadel Siege
card.ability: As Citadel Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.\n• Khans — At the beginning of combat on your turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.\n• Dragons — At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, tap target creature that player controls.

card.name: Cloudform
card.ability: When Cloudform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Cloudform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)\nEnchanted creature has flying and hexproof.

card.name: Collateral Damage
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Collateral Damage, sacrifice a creature.\nCollateral Damage deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: It is much easier to create fire than to contain it.

card.name: Crucible of the Spirit Dragon
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Crucible of the Spirit Dragon.\n{T}, Remove X storage counters from Crucible of the Spirit Dragon: Add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Dragon spells or activate abilities of Dragons.

card.name: Crux of Fate
card.ability: Choose one —\n• Destroy all Dragon creatures.\n• Destroy all non-Dragon creatures.
card.flavor: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.

card.name: Cunning Strike
card.ability: Cunning Strike deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "The opponent who blocks the path, becomes the path."\n—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

card.name: Daghatar the Adamant
card.ability: Vigilance\nDaghatar the Adamant enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.\n{1}{BG}{BG}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto a second target creature.
card.flavor: "Our victories will protect a thousand generations."

card.name: Dark Deal
card.ability: Each player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards minus one.
card.flavor: The first khans of the Sultai relied on the magic of the rakshasa to ensure the survival of the clan.

card.name: Defiant Ogre
card.ability: When Defiant Ogre enters the battlefield, choose one —\n• Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Ogre.\n• Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: "I have no clan, but I still have purpose."

card.name: Destructor Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Destructor Dragon dies, destroy target noncreature permanent.
card.flavor: After countless attacks on the Salt Road where it passes through the frozen tundra, the Abzan began to refer to the area as Atarka territory rather than Temur lands.

card.name: Diplomacy of the Wastes
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. If you control a Warrior, that player loses 2 life.
card.flavor: "Our emissaries are gifted negotiators."\n—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death

card.name: Dismal Backwater
card.ability: Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Douse in Gloom
card.ability: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.

card.name: Dragon Bell Monk
card.ability: Vigilance\nProwess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: He has spent years training his eyes and ears to detect the subtle signs of a dragon's approach.

card.name: Dragonrage
card.ability: Add {R} to your mana pool for each attacking creature you control. Until end of turn, attacking creatures you control gain "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
card.flavor: "Dragons in the skies of Tarkir—for the first time, it feels like my home."\n—Sarkhan Vol

card.name: Dragonscale General
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, bolster X, where X is the number of tapped creatures you control. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put X +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: "Dragons seek war. I bring it to them."

card.name: Dromoka, the Eternal
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever a Dragon you control attacks, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: "The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."\n—Daghatar the Adamant

card.name: Elite Scaleguard
card.ability: When Elite Scaleguard enters the battlefield, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)\nWhenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

card.name: Enhanced Awareness
card.ability: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
card.flavor: "Study the topography of your enemies, and you will have a map to victory."\n—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

card.name: Ethereal Ambush
card.ability: Manifest the top two cards of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: The energies of the Temur lands are readily unleashed upon intruders.

card.name: Fascination
card.ability: Choose one —\n• Each player draws X cards.\n• Each player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Fearsome Awakening
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's a Dragon, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
card.flavor: On Tarkir, dragons emerge from enormous tempests, phenomena tied to Ugin's very presence on the plane.

card.name: Feral Krushok
card.flavor: In a stunning act of diplomacy, Yasova Dragonclaw ceded a portion of Temur lands to the Sultai. Her clan protested until they saw she had given the Sultai the breeding grounds of the krushoks. They hadn't realized she had a sense of humor.

card.name: Fierce Invocation
card.ability: Manifest the top card of your library, then put two +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: Anger can empower those who embrace it.

card.name: Flamerush Rider
card.ability: Whenever Flamerush Rider attacks, put a token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that's a copy of another target attacking creature. Exile the token at end of combat.\nDash {2}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Flamewake Phoenix
card.ability: Flying, haste\nFlamewake Phoenix attacks each turn if able.\nFerocious — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Flamewake Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Formless Nurturing
card.ability: Manifest the top card of your library, then put a +1/+1 counter on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Friendly Fire
card.ability: Target creature's controller reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Friendly Fire deals damage to that creature and that player equal to the revealed card's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "Never tell goblins to ‘fire at will.'"\n—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief

card.name: Frontier Mastodon
card.ability: Ferocious — Frontier Mastodon enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: Each bronze disk on its harness is an offering from a young Temur hunter, a sign of respect to the spirits of the wild.

card.name: Frontier Siege
card.ability: As Frontier Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.\n• Khans — At the beginning of each of your main phases, add {G}{G} to your mana pool.\n• Dragons — Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.

card.name: Frost Walker
card.ability: When Frost Walker becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
card.flavor: "As the clans carved out their territories, we saw allies where the Mardu saw only obstacles."\n—Yasova Dragonclaw

card.name: Fruit of the First Tree
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhen enchanted creature dies, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is its toughness.
card.flavor: "I will be the ancestor my descendants call upon for aid. On that day I will take up my sword for my family once more."

card.name: Ghastly Conscription
card.ability: Exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard in a face-down pile, shuffle that pile, then manifest those cards. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Goblin Boom Keg
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Goblin Boom Keg.\nWhen Goblin Boom Keg is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Dragonfire spawned many imitations. Some were more dramatic than others.

card.name: Goblin Heelcutter
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Heelcutter attacks, target creature can't block this turn.\nDash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Gore Swine
card.flavor: "The Mardu are like the gore swine. We are wild, hunt in packs, and rarely clean the blood from our blades."\n—Vallash, Mardu warrior

card.name: Grave Strength
card.ability: Choose target creature. Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: So long as death follows life, the supply lines of the Sultai will never be cut.

card.name: Great-Horn Krushok
card.flavor: Perfectly suited for life in the Shifting Wastes, the krushok is well protected by its horn, its hide, and its temper.

card.name: Grim Contest
card.ability: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its toughness to the other.
card.flavor: The invader hoped he could survive the beast's jaws and emerge through its rotting skin.

card.name: Gurmag Angler
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
card.flavor: If everything in the Gurmag Swamp hungers for human flesh, what bait could be more effective?

card.name: Harsh Sustenance
card.ability: Harsh Sustenance deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.
card.flavor: The Shifting Wastes provide refuge to those who know where to look for it.

card.name: Hero's Blade
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +3/+2.\nWhenever a legendary creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may attach Hero's Blade to it.\nEquip {4}
card.flavor: The best swords are forged with dragonfire.

card.name: Hewed Stone Retainers
card.ability: Cast Hewed Stone Retainers only if you've cast another spell this turn.
card.flavor: "Their origins are shrouded in mystery. I believe they are the protectors of the lost secrets of our world."\n—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

card.name: Honor's Reward
card.ability: You gain 4 life. Bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: It seldom rains in Abzan lands. When it does, the khan marks the occasion by honoring the families of the fallen.

card.name: Hooded Assassin
card.ability: When Hooded Assassin enters the battlefield, choose one —\n• Put a +1/+1 counter on Hooded Assassin.\n• Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

card.name: Humble Defector
card.ability: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: "You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."\n—Houn, Jeskai elder

card.name: Hungering Yeti
card.ability: As long as you control a green or blue permanent, you may cast Hungering Yeti as though it had flash. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
card.flavor: No clan is as adept at saying "go away" as the Temur.

card.name: Hunt the Weak
card.ability: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.flavor: Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.
card.ruling:
7/18/2014 : You can’t cast Hunt the Weak unless you choose both a creature you control and a creature you don’t control as targets. 
7/18/2014 : If either target is an illegal target when Hunt the Weak tries to resolve, neither creature will deal or be dealt damage. 
7/18/2014 : If the creature you control is an illegal target when Hunt the Weak tries to resolve, you won’t put a +1/+1 counter on it. If that creature is a legal target but the creature you don’t control isn’t, you’ll still put the counter on the creature you control.

card.name: Jeskai Barricade
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nDefender\nWhen Jeskai Barricade enters the battlefield, you may return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

card.name: Jeskai Infiltrator
card.ability: Jeskai Infiltrator can't be blocked as long as you control no other creatures.\nWhen Jeskai Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, exile it and the top card of your library in a face-down pile, shuffle that pile, then manifest those cards. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Jeskai Runemark
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.\nEnchanted creature has flying as long as you control a red or white permanent.

card.name: Jeskai Sage
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhen Jeskai Sage dies, draw a card.
card.flavor: "The one who conquers the mind is greater than the one who conquers the world."

card.name: Jungle Hollow
card.ability: Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Kolaghan, the Storm's Fury
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever a Dragon you control attacks, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.\nDash {3}{B}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Lightform
card.ability: When Lightform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Lightform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)\nEnchanted creature has flying and lifelink.

card.name: Lightning Shrieker
card.ability: Flying, trample, haste\nAt the beginning of the end step, Lightning Shrieker's owner shuffles it into his or her library.
card.flavor: Dragonslayers learned to keep silent about their deeds after seeing the terrible vengeance wrought by Kolaghan and her brood.

card.name: Lotus Path Djinn
card.ability: Flying\nProwess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: "The lotus takes root where body and mind intersect. It blooms when body and mind become one."

card.name: Lotus-Eye Mystics
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhen Lotus-Eye Mystics enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Every action has a foreseen purpose.

card.name: Map the Wastes
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

card.name: Marang River Prowler
card.ability: Marang River Prowler can't block and can't be blocked.\nYou may cast Marang River Prowler from your graveyard as long as you control a black or green permanent.
card.flavor: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.

card.name: Mardu Runemark
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.\nEnchanted creature has first strike as long as you control a white or black permanent.

card.name: Mardu Scout
card.ability: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)
card.flavor: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.

card.name: Mardu Shadowspear
card.ability: Whenever Mardu Shadowspear attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.\nDash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Mardu Strike Leader
card.ability: Whenever Mardu Strike Leader attacks, put a 2/1 black Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.\nDash {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
card.ability: Whenever Mardu Woe-Reaper or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."

card.name: Mastery of the Unseen
card.ability: Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.\n{3}{W}: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Merciless Executioner
card.ability: When Merciless Executioner enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: He enjoys his work, for he sees only the worst Abzan criminals: those who betray their own kin.

card.name: Mindscour Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever Mindscour Dragon deals combat damage to an opponent, target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: "The bells may one day ring as an anthem of our own end."\n—Kyu, Sage-Eye mystic

card.name: Mistfire Adept
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: "The quieter the skies, the calmer the mind."

card.name: Mob Rule
card.ability: Choose one —\n• Gain control of all creatures with power 4 or greater until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.\n• Gain control of all creatures with power 3 or less until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

card.name: Monastery Mentor
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a 1/1 white Monk creature token with prowess onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Speak little. Do much."

card.name: Monastery Siege
card.ability: As Monastery Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.\n• Khans — At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card, then discard a card.\n• Dragons — Spells your opponents cast that target you or a permanent you control cost {2} more to cast.

card.name: Neutralizing Blast
card.ability: Counter target multicolored spell.
card.flavor: "To defeat your enemies, you must remove their ability to make war against you."

card.name: Noxious Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
card.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.

card.name: Ojutai, Soul of Winter
card.ability: Flying, vigilance\nWhenever a Dragon you control attacks, tap target nonland permanent an opponent controls. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: "When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."\n—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest

card.name: Orc Sureshot
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Words have yet to halt an arrow."

card.name: Outpost Siege
card.ability: As Outpost Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.\n• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.\n• Dragons — Whenever a creature you control leaves the battlefield, Outpost Siege deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Palace Siege
card.ability: As Palace Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.\n• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.\n• Dragons — At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

card.name: Pilgrim of the Fires
card.ability: First strike, trample
card.flavor: The most skilled Jeskai artisans can craft imposing golems with such precision that they will last an eternity—the time believed necessary to master the Fires of the Jeskai Way.

card.name: Pressure Point
card.ability: Tap target creature.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: By studying dragon anatomy, Jeskai monks have learned how to locate clusters of nerves that will incapacitate even the mightiest dragons.

card.name: Pyrotechnics
card.ability: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
card.flavor: "Take inspiration from your enemies, and make their strengths your own."\n—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target. 
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage. 
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Qarsi High Priest
card.ability: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: "Hear me, nameless, and obey."

card.name: Rageform
card.ability: When Rageform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Rageform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)\nEnchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

card.name: Rakshasa's Disdain
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "Every failure, every death only makes my strength greater."

card.name: Rally the Ancestors
card.ability: Return each creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. Exile those creatures at the beginning of your next upkeep. Exile Rally the Ancestors.
card.flavor: "The family is a tree, and in times of need, every branch can be a weapon."\n—Daghatar the Adamant

card.name: Reach of Shadows
card.ability: Destroy target creature that's one or more colors.
card.flavor: "Is it better to be a fool or a coward? Fools may get things done occasionally, but cowards live longer."\n—Ghelesh Shadowmane, rakshasa mage

card.name: Reality Shift
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller manifests the top card of his or her library. (That player puts the top card of his or her library onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. If it's a creature card, it can be turned face up any time for its mana cost.)

card.name: Refocus
card.ability: Untap target creature.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."

card.name: Renowned Weaponsmith
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.\n{U}, {T}: Search your library for a card named Heart-Piercer Bow or Vial of Dragonfire, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Return to the Earth
card.ability: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.
card.flavor: "Dragons are feared for their breath and their bite, but it is their wings that make them unconquerable. Bring them to earth, and they die like any other beast."\n—Kassur, Sultai hunter

card.name: Rite of Undoing
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nReturn target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent you don't control to their owners' hands.

card.name: Rugged Highlands
card.ability: Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Ruthless Instincts
card.ability: Choose one —\n• Target nonattacking creature gains reach and deathtouch until end of turn. Untap it.\n• Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: A single battle affects countless others.

card.name: Sage-Eye Avengers
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhenever Sage-Eye Avengers attacks, you may return target creature to its owner's hand if its power is less than Sage-Eye Avengers's power.

card.name: Sage's Reverie
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhen Sage's Reverie enters the battlefield, draw a card for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.

card.name: Sandblast
card.ability: Sandblast deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: In the Shifting Wastes, more are killed by sand than by steel.

card.name: Sandsteppe Mastodon
card.ability: Reach\nWhen Sandsteppe Mastodon enters the battlefield, bolster 5. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put five +1/+1 counters on it.)
card.flavor: A mastodon's path always leads to an oasis.

card.name: Sandsteppe Outcast
card.ability: When Sandsteppe Outcast enters the battlefield, choose one —\n• Put a +1/+1 counter on Sandsteppe Outcast.\n• Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Scoured Barrens
card.ability: Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Scroll of the Masters
card.ability: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.\n{3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.

card.name: Shaman of the Great Hunt
card.ability: Haste\nWhenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.\nFerocious — {2}{GU}{GU}: Draw a card for each creature you control with power 4 or greater.

card.name: Shamanic Revelation
card.ability: Draw a card for each creature you control.\nFerocious — You gain 4 life for each creature you control with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: First, whispers of ancient days. Then, visions of things to come.

card.name: Shifting Loyalties
card.ability: Exchange control of two target permanents that share a card type. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker are card types.)
card.flavor: "Show the enemy the true path, and the spirit will yearn to follow it."\n—Houn, Jeskai elder

card.name: Shockmaw Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever Shockmaw Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals 1 damage to each creature that player controls.
card.flavor: Dragons of the Kolaghan brood are always on the move. They are the driving force behind the Mardu's nomadic way of life.

card.name: Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {RW}{RW}. If you do, target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

card.name: Sibsig Host
card.ability: When Sibsig Host enters the battlefield, each player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: "They were your friends, your family, your clan. They want only to welcome you."\n—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

card.name: Sibsig Muckdraggers
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nWhen Sibsig Muckdraggers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Silumgar, the Drifting Death
card.ability: Flying, hexproof\nWhenever a Dragon you control attacks, creatures defending player controls get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "No machinations, no puppet strings, no plots. Just pure, sweeping death."\n—Tasigur, the Golden Fang

card.name: Smoldering Efreet
card.ability: When Smoldering Efreet dies, it deals 2 damage to you.
card.flavor: The efreet are drawn to the Kaisham Wanderers, a loosely organized Jeskai school where trickery is employed to challenge the status quo and upend the belief systems of others.

card.name: Soul Summons
card.ability: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: Ugin's magic reaches beyond the dragons. The clans have adapted it for war.

card.name: Soulfire Grand Master
card.ability: Lifelink\nInstant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.\n{2}{UR}{UR}: The next time you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, put that card into your hand instead of into your graveyard as it resolves.

card.name: Soulflayer
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nIf a creature card with flying was exiled with Soulflayer's delve ability, Soulflayer has flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, reach, trample, and vigilance.

card.name: Sudden Reclamation
card.ability: Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard, then return a creature card and a land card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "There is no secret buried so deep that we will never find it."\n—Kurtar, Sultai necromancer

card.name: Sultai Emissary
card.ability: When Sultai Emissary dies, manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: To the Sultai, Ugin's power was just one more resource to be exploited.

card.name: Sultai Runemark
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.\nEnchanted creature has deathtouch as long as you control a green or blue permanent. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

card.name: Sultai Skullkeeper
card.ability: When Sultai Skullkeeper enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: A skullkeeper is the first to arrive after the palace archers strike down intruders, probing their brains for choice bits of knowledge.

card.name: Supplant Form
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that creature.
card.flavor: "Ice can be shaped to any form, even the whisper of a memory."\n—Mytha, Temur shaman

card.name: Swiftwater Cliffs
card.ability: Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Tasigur, the Golden Fang
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\n{2}{GU}{GU}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then return a nonland card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Tasigur's Cruelty
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nEach opponent discards two cards.
card.flavor: The cruelest tortures leave no mark upon the flesh.

card.name: Temporal Trespass
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nTake an extra turn after this one. Exile Temporal Trespass.
card.flavor: Few truly live in the moment.

card.name: Temur Battle Rage
card.ability: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)\nFerocious — That creature also gains trample until end of turn if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

card.name: Temur Runemark
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2.\nEnchanted creature has trample as long as you control a blue or red permanent.

card.name: Temur Sabertooth
card.ability: {1}{G}: You may return another creature you control to its owner's hand. If you do, Temur Sabertooth gains indestructible until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Temur see themselves as a pack, their bonds more primal than the Abzan's.

card.name: Temur War Shaman
card.ability: When Temur War Shaman enters the battlefield, manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)\nWhenever a permanent you control is turned face up, if it's a creature, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.

card.name: Thornwood Falls
card.ability: Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Torrent Elemental
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever Torrent Elemental attacks, tap all creatures defending player controls.\n{3}{BG}{BG}: Put Torrent Elemental from exile onto the battlefield tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Tranquil Cove
card.ability: Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Typhoid Rats
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor: When Tasigur sent his ambassadors to the Abzan outpost, the true envoys were not the naga but the infectious rats they carried with them.

card.name: Ugin, the Spirit Dragon
card.ability: +2: Ugin, the Spirit Dragon deals 3 damage to target creature or player.\n−X: Exile each permanent with converted mana cost X or less that's one or more colors.\n−10: You gain 7 life, draw seven cards, then put up to seven permanent cards from your hand onto the battlefield.

card.name: Ugin's Construct
card.ability: When Ugin's Construct enters the battlefield, sacrifice a permanent that's one or more colors.
card.flavor: While trapping the Eldrazi on Zendikar, Ugin learned little from Sorin, but he gleaned the rudiments of lithomancy from Nahiri.

card.name: Valorous Stance
card.ability: Choose one —\n• Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn.\n• Destroy target creature with toughness 4 or greater.
card.flavor: "Every choice alters the path of fate."\n—Sarkhan Vol

card.name: Vaultbreaker
card.ability: Whenever Vaultbreaker attacks, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.\nDash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

card.name: Wandering Champion
card.ability: Whenever Wandering Champion deals combat damage to a player, if you control a blue or red permanent, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
card.flavor: "Learn from your enemies, but do not tolerate them."

card.name: War Flare
card.ability: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Untap those creatures.
card.flavor: "No sun or fire can warm my blood quite like a war flare."\n—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief

card.name: Warden of the First Tree
card.ability: {1}{WB}: Warden of the First Tree becomes a Human Warrior with base power and toughness 3/3.\n{2}{WB}{WB}: If Warden of the First Tree is a Warrior, it becomes a Human Spirit Warrior with trample and lifelink.\n{3}{WB}{WB}{WB}: If Warden of the First Tree is a Spirit, put five +1/+1 counters on it.

card.name: Wardscale Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nAs long as Wardscale Dragon is attacking, defending player can't cast spells.
card.flavor: Dromoka's brood emerge from the dragon tempests covered with tough scales that protect them from most clan weapons and magic.

card.name: Whisk Away
card.ability: Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.
card.flavor: The maneuvers of the Abzan formation intrigued Ojutai in both their complexity and their futility.

card.name: Whisperer of the Wilds
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.\nFerocious — {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: She speaks only in whispers but can be heard over the fiercest storm.

card.name: Whisperwood Elemental
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)\nSacrifice Whisperwood Elemental: Until end of turn, face-up nontoken creatures you control gain "When this creature dies, manifest the top card of your library."

card.name: Wild Slash
card.ability: Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, damage can't be prevented this turn.\nWild Slash deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Never mistake deception for cleverness.

card.name: Wildcall
card.ability: Manifest the top card of your library, then put X +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
card.flavor: A howl on the wind hides many dangers.

card.name: Will of the Naga
card.ability: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)\nTap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: The charm of a naga is undeniable.

card.name: Winds of Qal Sisma
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.\nFerocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, instead prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures your opponents control.

card.name: Wind-Scarred Crag
card.ability: Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.\n{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Write into Being
card.ability: Look at the top two cards of your library. Manifest one of those cards, then put the other on the top or bottom of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

card.name: Yasova Dragonclaw
card.ability: Trample\nAt the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {1}{UR}{UR}. If you do, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power less than Yasova Dragonclaw's power until end of turn, untap that creature, and it gains haste until end of turn.
